p: 10 g of the powder of C. Europaea was macerated with distilled water for 5 or 6 h, boiled for 30 min, and kept aside for 1 h. The material was filtered through a muslin cloth. Acetone was added to the filtrate in order to precipitate the mucilage. The mucilage was separated and dried at a temperature under 50°C. The dried mucilage was powdered and stored for further use [ 23].
